intro: Mollia speciosa, commonly known as the showy mallows, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Mollia speciosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
